definition: to understand (by hearing)/to catch (what sb says)
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: People in many countries can understand English songs.
sentences.chinese: 很多国家的人们都听得懂英文歌曲。

sentences.english: He slurred English. No man could understand him.
sentences.chinese: 他含糊不清地说着英语，没人能听得懂他说的是什么。

sentences.english: Can you make out what he is saying?
sentences.chinese: 他在说什么，你能听得懂吗？
我说的台语你听得懂喔？

sentences.english: Which of these mortal hearts understands raillery ?
sentences.chinese: 这些凡人的心，有谁听得懂玩笑？

sentences.english: And they did not know that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between them.
sentences.chinese: 他们不知道约瑟听得懂，因为在他们中间有传译的人。

sentences.english: If you speak slowly, I understand.
No one understood what this meant, and, intruth, neither did we.
sentences.chinese: 没人听得懂这是什么意思，说实话，我俩也不懂。
没有人能听得懂他在说些什么。

sentences.english: "I got every word," says the parrot.

definition: to understand (on hearing)/to catch (what is spoken)
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
